programme.title: Space Channel News Update | Deep Space Technologies
programme.desc: Back in 2006, to minimize competition, Boeing and North Grumman decided to form a joint venture for a period of time, realizing that they would no longer be bidding against each other for giant NASA contracts. This plan worked swimmingly until newcomers SpaceX arrived on the scene, and there was competition again. Duration: 1800

programme.title: Space Tourist
programme.desc: Space Tourist goes to Australia, UAE and Los Angeles to find great Derek and luxury stargazing vacations as well as all the space related activities in Los Angeles. Including experiencing Zero-G! Duration: 1800

programme.title: Space Dealers
programme.desc: In the world of space dealing everyone is making deals...some might not work out so well. Duration: 3600

programme.title: Planets with David Becker
programme.desc: For more than three decades, Grammy and Emmy nominated guitarist, composer, producer David Becker has continued to define himself as one of the best and most unique voices in jazz and contemporary music by combining diverse influences and a passion for the new and different, and his ability to play for the present while always keeping an eye on the past and future. He has led the critically acclaimed DAVID BECKER TRIBUNE to a worldwide audience by performing in more than 35 countries. Duration: 3600

programme.title: Latest News - Virgin Galactic China update
programme.desc: So you wanna go to space? Well, now's your chance. Although you may be waiting awhile. Virgin Galactic has just opened ticket sales to the public for flights to the edge of space. programme.title: David Becker - Truth Lies Within
programme.desc: Jazz Guitarist David Becker captures the ultimate Universal duality that's hard to ignore. programme.title: SpinLaunch
programme.desc: American spaceflight technology development company, SpinLaunch, has signed a Space Act Agreement with NASA. Space Act Agreements are made possible by the National Aeronautics and Space Act of 1958 that empowers NASA to fund a domestic partner, such as a private company or a university, to accomplish an NASA agency mission. Duration: 171

programme.title: StellarVue Telescopes
programme.desc: Stellarvue is more than just a telescope company. Since 1998, Stellarvue has fostered a global community (a '"Stellar-family") of employees and customers who are passionate about astronomy, education, and viewing the night sky through high-quality telescopes. Today, Stellarvue continues to use innovative technology to produce high-quality optics that provide exceptionally clear, sharp views of celestial objects. Duration: 431

programme.title: ISS Then and Now
programme.desc: A brief history of the ISS, from the first module to the future of Space Stations Duration: 150

programme.title: SpaceX update 5-16-22
programme.desc: According to SPACEX President and CEO Gwynne Shotwell in a CNBC interview, we’ll put people on Mars within the decade. She goes on to say that getting a large delivery to the surface will get people to start thinking about Mars as a real place to go. Duration: 145
